title: Heise 3 lifts ISU hours after sister scores for U.S.
content: Hours after sister Taylor Heise scored to help the U.S. women's Olympic hockey team beat Sweden 5-0 in Milan, Nate Heise hit a go-ahead 3-pointer in No. 6 Iowa State's thrilling 70-67 victory over Big 12 leader and second-ranked Houston on Monday night.

title: Hill, cut by Fins, vows 'the Cheetah will be back'

title: U.S. women's hockey to face Canada in final
content: The Americans continued their dominant run through the women's hockey tournament, routing Sweden 5-0 to reach the gold medal game vs. Canada.

content: NBA All-Star Weekend delivered -- on and off the court. Let's unpack everything we saw (and heard) in Los Angeles.

content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

content: Neither the third or fourth rounds of the FA Cup used VAR, yet they produced opposite reactions on whether soccer needs the technology.

content: The new MLS season for 2026 is about to begin, and with it comes changes to the league's schedule. So what exactly is the plan?

content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Madras High Court refuses to extend time granted to actor Vishal for depositing ₹10 crore
content: Justices C.V. Karthikeyan and K. Kumaresh Babu hold that his application filed on December 18, 2025 seeking eight weeks time has become infructuous

title: Repatriate 'gangster' Kumar Pillai to Hong Kong: Court; cites acquittal in extradition cases

content: “It is a matter of great pride that students from Andhra Pradesh have showcased their talent at the national level in the JEE Mains results,” Nara Lokesh posted on X

title: Supreme Court rules out murder by strangulation in 2002 Telugu actor death case
content: A Bench of Justices Manoj Misra and Manmohan said there was “overwhelming” ocular and medical evidence of poisoning

title: Bengaluru’s Kempegowda International Airport shipped 60 million rose stems in 2026 Valentine’s season, 38% year-on-year increase in volume and 64% rise in tonnage
content: International shipments remained steady at 305 MT with Singapore emerging as the top overseas destination, followed by Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), Abu Dhabi (UAE), New York (US), and Kuwait

title: Actor Jayaram appears before ED for questioning in Sabarimala gold case
content: Jayaram has been asked to appear for questioning in the wake of his association and reported financial transactions with Unnikrishnan Potti, prime accused in the case

title: Indore MBA student's classmate abused her body after killing; performed witchcraft: Police
content: “The woman’s body was found in her classmate's rented house,” Deputy Commissioner of Police Shrikrishna Lalchandani said

content: HYDRAA Commissioner A.V. Ranganath reviewed all 59 petitions and assigned them to the respective officials for redressal

title: Unemployed youths line up in Kolkata to avail State’s  ₹1,500 Aid
content: West Bengal’s Banglar Yuva Sathi scheme, offering Rs 1,500 monthly allowance to unemployed youths aged 21–40, has drawn massive response. Enrollment camps are underway from February 15–26, 10 am to 5 pm

title: Mohali schools receive bomb threat emails, Fortis Hospital also mentioned
content: "The bomb threat to schools also mentioned the Fortis Hospital in Mohali, where we conducted anti-sabotage checks. Non-essential services were kept on hold while essential services continued," a senior police official said in Mohali

title: PM to lay stone of north India's first semiconductor unit, open Namo Bharat corridor in U.P. next week
content: CM Yogi Adityanath said that the foundation stone of the semiconductor unit in Gautam Buddh Nagar would be laid on February 21, terming it a significant step towards making the State a hub for high-technology manufacturing

title: Two die of suspected food poisoning after eating at restaurant in Kerala’s Vizhinjam
content: Family of six had dinner late on Monday night from the restaurant that specialises in seafood dishes. Four later developed uneasiness and were hospitalised

title: Awareness of body donation essential, says Dr. Mahantesh Ramannavar
content: Dr. Mahantesh Ramannavar, HoD of Anatomy at KLE B.M. Kankanwadi Ayurveda College, Belagavi, said that a thorough understanding of human anatomy and physiology is essential to shape competent and compassionate doctors who can serve society effectively

title: National Woman Thinkers’ conference in Delhi on March 7-8, webinar series in north Karnataka from February 21-26
content: Participants would deliberate on various issues and the resolutions emerging from these discussions will be submitted to the Union Government

title: ‘You don't deserve that chair’: Navjot Kaur Sidhu lashes out at Rahul Gandhi after quitting Congress
content: “You have to be in touch with the ground reality to know. You can’t be living in a dream world,” Ms. Sidhu said of Rahul Gandhi

title: Free health camp by United Hospital in Kalaburagi to celebrate anniversary on February 18
content: The management stated that the anniversary health camp forms part of its ongoing efforts to promote preventive healthcare and early diagnosis among people

title: A separate classification for denotified tribes | Explained
content: Why were Denotified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Tribes classified as ‘criminal’ groups in the colonial era? What did the Idate Commission recommend? What was the problem with the SEED scheme rolled out by the Social Justice Ministry? Why do community leaders demand a separate classification for DNTs?

title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2026-27 LIVE updates: TN asks Centre to approve Coimbatore, Madurai metro rail projects
content: State's Economic Survey 2025-26 said Tamil Nadu can achieve its trillion-dollar economy milestone by 2031 if it sustains the 2024-25 nominal growth rate of 16%

title: Bihar Congress conducts training for its observers amid delay in naming legislature party leader
content: Addressing the observers, Bihar Congress President Rajesh Ram said that the primary objective of the campaign is to strengthen the Congress Party’s organisation, and the selected members will be entrusted with greater responsibility and power

title: At least 175 people, mostly children, fall ill after consuming 'contaminated' food in Jharkhand
content: The food was allegedly consumed at a fair organised on Mahashivratri; most of the patients were suffering from vomiting, diarrhoea and abdominal pain

title: Maharashtra forms task force to address climate change and prevent farmers’ suicides
content: A 10-member panel comprising eight government officials and two experts held its first meeting on Monday

title: After HC order, Odisha government declares to catalogue jewelleries of Shree Jagannath Temple soon
content: The Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the counting and inventory prepared by the Shree Jagannath Temple Managing Committee is waiting for government’s approval

title: India's January trade deficit widens before U.S. tariff relief kicks in
content: A trade delegation will travel to Washington next week to finalise a trade agreement, Rajesh Agrawal, India’s ‌trade secretary

title: M.P. Assembly’s Budget Session begins with uproar over Indore deaths during Governor’s address
content: The day’s proceedings commenced with the singing of six stanzas of the national song Vande Matram in accordance with the Union Ministry of Home Affairs’ January 28 directive

title: ‘Advance of AI creating a governance responsibility’
content: Ajay Kumar Sood noted that more evidence is needed to understand how these tools impact a child’s development, mental health and education over time

title: Only Stalin can consolidate INDIA bloc to help Rahul become PM: Mani Shankar Aiyar
content: The Congress leader quotes Dr. Ambedkar to explain his estrangement from the Congress. “I am not a part of the whole; I am a part apart,” he says. He criticises Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, K.C. Venugopal and Pawan Khera.

title: With Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, Jammu and Kashmir plans to harness river waters
content: The J&K government has made a proposal to enable year-round navigation on the Wular lake by maintaining a minimum depth of water, which was not possible because of the Indus Waters Treaty

title: India’s federalism is in need of a structural reset
content: There is a need for balanced federalism in the form of autonomous States, an efficient Union, and accountable governance

title: Panel on Union-State relations submits initial report to CM
content: The report made out a case for decentralisation and State autonomy and outlined among other things issues relating to amendment of the Constitution;  territorial integrity of States, the Governor, and delimitation

title: Aequs Group to invest ₹4,000 crore; NMB-Minebea India Private Limited ₹1,980 crore in Tamil Nadu
content: Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa says the Aequs’ project would be India’s first fully vertically integrated aircraft engine manufacturing project

title: FEMA adjudicating authority imposes ₹184 crore penalty on NewsClick, founder Prabir Purkayastha
content: The adjudication proceedings were initiated on a complaint under Section 16 of FEMA filed by the ED alleging contraventions of FEMA and the rules and regulations pertaining to the receipt and utilisation of foreign funds

title: Municipal chiefs’ elections expose Congress-BJP power pact: Harish Rao
content: The former minister says Congress and BJP have shunned their ideologies for power in Telangana; he asks Congress whether joining hands with BJP is the change it promised

title: Security beefed up as courts in Uttar Pradesh receive bomb threat emails
content: The 18 districts which received the threats include Lucknow, Varanasi, Moradabad, Meerut, Ayodhya among others

title: Farmers in Villupuram, Puducherry call for early steps to repair Sornavur anicut across Thenpennai River
content: The anicut is a vital structure from where the water is diverted to the Bangaru Vaickal bringing water to several irrigation tanks in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry including the major tank of Bahour

title: SRIHER sets up centre of excellence for craniofacial care
content: The Centre offers advanced and holistic treatment for patients with cleft lip, cleft palate, and complex craniofacial conditions

title: Congress veteran Aiyar comes down on party’s State, national leadership
content: He says he will retract his prediction of a third term for CM Pinarayi Vijayan if the Congress endorses Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan as the UDF’s Chief Minister candidate. Aiyar also paints a grim picture of UDF’s electoral prospects

title: Isn’t checking infiltration your job, Assam party asks Amit Shah
content: The Barak Democratic Front has requested the Home Minister to publish a White Paper on the number of illegal infiltrators detected and expelled during the last 10 years of the BJP rule

title: Operational preparedness and integrated functioning among services vital, says Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh
content: Air Chief addresses the Annual Commanders’ Conference of the Southern Air Command in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Better for Congress to remain in  DMK-led front for its own sake, says CPI(M) State secretary
content: The Congress has raised the issue of power-sharing in Tamil Nadu at an inappropriate time, says P. Shanmugam. The CPI(M) will not take part in a coalition government, as its policy is not to be part of a government led by another party, he says

title: Congress says U.S. trade deal ‘mortgages’ farmer interests, energy security and digital autonomy
content: Congress leader and ex-Commerce Minister Anand Sharma claimed UPA govt. negotiated trade deals as ‘sovereign equals’, calls the interim trade agreement with the U.S. as a ‘sell-out’

title: Watch: AI Summit 2026: PM Modi inaugurates India AI Impact Expo
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on February 16, inaugurated the India AI Impact Summit 2026 at Bharat Mandapam in the national capital, underscoring India’s commitment to responsible and inclusive Artificial Intelligence.

title: Centre, BJP-ruled States ignoring injustice to gig workers: Rahul Gandhi
content: Class and caste-based discrimination are deeply embedded in the sector, and there is little accountability for companies, Congress leader says

title: Supreme Court allows Abu Salem to withdraw appeal on remission
content: Bench headed by Justice Vikram Nath leaves it open to convicted gangster Abu Salem to approach Bombay High Court for early listing of his pending case

title: 851 cases booked against erring auto drivers
content: Major violations detected during the drive included obstructive parking, charging excess fares, zebra crossing violations, jumping traffic signals and parking in undesignated zones

title: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu, Rabri Devi in land-for-jobs scam case
content: The CBI has alleged that no advertisements or public notices were issued for the appointments and the appointees sold or gifted land parcels to Lalu Prasad, his family members and a private firm

title: Two Pakistan nationals among three men escape observation home in Jammu: officials
content: The trio allegedly assaulted the guards on duty and managed to escape from the facility. One of the accused also brandished a pistol to threaten the staff of the observation home

title: KPCC leadership meeting says no second chances or cushioning posts for party candidates who lose the Assembly polls
content: According to party sources, AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal termed the polls as an existential battle; he said meritocracy would play a major role in candidate selection.

title: Global digital platforms must respect cultures and local laws, says Vaishnaw
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says there are no “physical boundaries” in the digital world, but acceptability keeps changing with societies; he says Indians are “digitally native” and adapt to new technologies easily

title: Full Cabinet and Ministers’ portfolio will be decided soon: Manipur Deputy CM
content: Deputy Chief Minister Losii Dikho says the rehabilitation of people displaced by the long violence in the State is a priority for the new government; on his colleague Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki-Zo leader, not being able to travel to Imphal, he says, ‘She is supporting us to reach out to the people’; the State government plans to hold a Cabinet meeting in Senapati, a Naga area, and go there via Kangpokpi, a Kuki-Zo area

title: Satheesan calls for revised affidavit on women’s entry to Sabarimala
content: Mr. Satheesan said that the government should notify the court that its earlier pro-women’s entry stance has shifted

title: High drama, clashes and postponements mark municipal chairman elections across Telangana
content: Authorities postponed elections in 11 civic bodies due to disputes, protests, lack of quorum, and allegations of political interference

title: Assistant professor found dead, husband alleges harassment by principal of school in south Bengaluru
content: The complainant alleged that the principal had repeatedly humiliated his wife in front of staff on several occasions

title: Supreme Court to take a fresh look at pleas on ex post facto eco clearance regime
content: Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant schedules the case for hearing on February 25 and says the court will not tolerate any adjournments on that day

title: ‘Release Sonam Wangchuk,’ says farmer group in Maharashtra’s Miraj
content: Members of the Shetkari Sanghatana condemned the Union government’s decision to keep the environmental activist behind bars

title: UPSC given a week’s time to file affidavit on software for visually impaired candidates
content: The apex court had on December 3, 2025, directed the UPSC to incorporate a provision allowing eligible candidates to request a change of scribe till at least seven days before the test

title: Forest dept. set to introduce coracle rides at Panamkuzhy Ecotourism Centre
content: The initiative is expected to increase visitor footfall at the ecotourism centre and help generate additional revenue

title: Women to redefine urban leadership with Congress candidates being the maximum
content: Out of the seven municipal corporations that went to polls in the State, three mayoral posts were reserved for women, and significantly, all the women mayors belong to the Congress, underlining the party’s overwhelming dominance

title: Video Filmed In SUV Shows Moment Delhi Teen's Car Collided Head-On With Bike
content: A video recorded inside the Scorpio SUV that hit 23-year-old Sahil Dhaneshra, killing him, reveals fresh details on the horrific accident on a Delhi road. The footage shows the moment the SUV, driven by a teen, rammed the bike on February 3.

title: Bill Gates Won't Attend India AI Impact Summit 2026: Sources
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates is not expected to attend the India AI Impact Summit, government sources told NDTV Tuesday morning

title: Government Issues High-Severity Alert For Google Chrome Users
content: The government has issued a high-severity cybersecurity warning for users of the popular Google Chrome browser, urging immediate action to protect devices from serious security threats.

title: 'He Screamed For Help For 10 Minutes': Mother Of Delhi Man Killed In Crash
content: The mother of the 23-year-old who died in a recent car crash where a minor was at the wheels, said there are multiple challans on the car.

title: "Haemorrhage, Skull Fracture": Autopsy Of Delhi Man Killed By Teen Driver
content: An autopsy report has shed light on the tragic death of 23-year-old Sahil Dhaneshra, who was killed earlier this month in a multi-vehicle collision in Dwarka.

title: 'Child Rapist': ICE Says Indian 'Alien' Sexually Assaulted 13-Year-Old
content: An Indian man has been detained in the United States for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor. US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) said the accused, identified as Vodela Yashaswi Kottapalli, is an undocumented immigrant in America.

title: Bengaluru Family Forgets 4-Year-Old In Cab, Traced By Cops In An Hour
content: Afour-year-old child was accidentally left behind by his family inside a cab in Bengaluru, but was traced within an hour with the police's help.

title: Ajit Pawar's Son Parth May Get Big Relief In Land Deal Case: Sources
content: Parth Pawar, the son of former NCP chief late Ajit Pawar, has got a clean chit in an investigation into alleged irregularities in a Maharashtra land deal, sources have said.

title: 13-Hour Traffic Curb On Mumbai's Western Express Highway Amid PM Modi-Macron Meet
content: Western Express Highway, one of Mumbai's busiest north-south corridors, will witness extensive traffic restrictions on Tuesday.

title: On Camera, Karnataka Class 10 Student Dies After Jumping From School Hostel
content: A Class 10 student from Karnataka's Chitradurga district died after jumping from the third floor of his school's hostel building.

title: Man Stabs Bhopal Woman 13 Times, Then Jumps In Front Of Train
content: A 45-year-old woman in Bhopal was stabbed to death nine times in the chest, three times in the abdomen, and once in the neck allegedly by a man who had been living in her house.

title: Murder Case Against Chhattisgarh Officer After Man Dies During Illegal Mining Probe
content: Serious allegations against a revenue administration team in Chhattisgarh's Kusmi village have triggered outrage and tension across the region.

title: "We Are In AI Era": Top Court Raps Centre Over Sonam Wangchuk Transcripts
content: There is certain malice if the transcription of a 3-minute speech runs for 7-8 minutes, the Supreme Court has said, pulling up the Centre over the translation of activist Sonam Wangchuk's speech, based on which he was arrested in September.

title: "Deeply Regret My Association": Hyatt Executive Resigns Over Epstein Ties
content: The executive chairman of the Hyatt hotel chain stepped down Monday after emails revealing his ties to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein came to light.

title: Gold Down Rs 1,145, Silver Slides 1.5% In Morning Trade: Check City-Wise Prices
content: Precious metals traded lower on Tuesday morning even as retail prices across major cities remained firm.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 2 LIVE Updates: Applied AI And Social Equity Key Themes
content: India AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: The summit at Delhi's Bharat Mandapamwill enter its second day on Tuesday, a day afterPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the expo featuring 600 startups and 13 country pavillions.

title: Election Commission Team Visits Poll-Bound Assam, Holds Key Meetings
content: A team of the Election Commission, headed by poll body chief Gyanesh Kumar, arrived in Assam on February 16 for a three-day visit to assess preparedness for the upcoming Assembly elections in the state.

title: AI Summit Asserts India's Global Ambitions After Tough Year
content: Six months ago, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was fending off verbal attacks from US President Donald Trump, trying to regain the upper hand over Pakistan after an armed conflict, and facing questions about his economy's prospects.

title: "You Don't Deserve That Chair": Navjot Kaur Sidhu Hits Out At Rahul Gandhi
content: Shortly after her exit from the Congress, former MLA Navjot Kaur Sidhu has hit out at Rahul Gandhi, Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha, saying that he is disconnected from ground realities and that what he does and says is very different.

title: AI Summit To Potential Rafale Contract: What's On Macron's India Agenda
content: French President Emmanuel Macron is in Mumbai for a three-day visit to India, where he's scheduled to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and attend an artificial intelligence summit.

title: Warning for contenders! Sri Lanka emerge as team to beat at the T20 World Cup
content: Sri Lanka have stormed into the Super 8s with three dominant wins, showcasing championship potential. Their emphatic victory over Australia, chasing 182 with ease, highlights their mastery of home conditions and growing confidence. Despite key injuries, the team's strong performance and Pathum Nissanka's century signal Sri Lanka's serious semi-final aspirations.

title: KPMG puts thousands of dollars fine on partner for using AI to pass AI test
content: A KPMG Australia partner faced a $7,000 fine for using AI to cheat on an internal AI training course. This incident highlights a broader issue, with over two dozen staff caught using AI for exams.  The firm is strengthening its AI detection, as similar cheating scandals plague the accounting industry, prompting concerns about governance and integrity.

title: ‘Died due to someone’s fun reel’: Son killed by underage SUV driver in Delhi; mother seeks justice
content: A grieving mother alleges her son's fatal road crash was due to a minor's reckless stunt driving for social media reels. Sahil Dhaneshra, 23, died when an SUV allegedly driven by a minor, reportedly without a license, veered into his lane. The mother demands strict action against those responsible, highlighting the minor's alleged prior violations and the vehicle owner's inaction.

title: 'I didn't argue emotionally': Teen argues own case in SC to secure MBBS admission in EWS quota, wins
content: A 19-year-old NEET aspirant, Atharva Chaturvedi, successfully argued his own case before the Supreme Court after being denied MBBS admission due to the non-implementation of EWS reservation in Madhya Pradesh private colleges. The court directed his admission, acknowledging administrative failures and the petitioner's circumstances.

title: Ishan Kishan 2.0: The method behind the mayhem
content: Ishan Kishan's return to domestic cricket has revitalised his career, showcasing a fearless yet methodical approach. After being axed from the Indian setup in 2023, his dedication to First Class cricket and strong performances in limited-overs tournaments have put him back in contention, demonstrating a significant improvement in his game.

title: Jim Cramer has this 'joker message' for those saying Anthropic code can do software jobs
content: Renowned investor Jim Cramer expressed skepticism about major law firms entrusting high-stakes client work to AI, questioning the current reliability of tools like Anthropic's Claude.  His comments follow a significant market downturn in software and tech stocks, triggered by the launch of AI plugins that analysts dubbed a 'SaaSpocalypse'.

title: Bomb threat at Mohali hospital; CM Bhagwant Mann among patients
content: A bomb threat email targeting Fortis Hospital Mohali and nearby schools prompted a high-security response, with authorities deploying bomb disposal squads and dog teams. The threat, allegedly from the "Khalistan National Army," is being investigated, though similar past threats were hoaxes. Security is heightened due to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's presence at the hospital.

title: Consensual relationship, not sexual assault: Delhi HC sets aside rape FIR
content: The petitioner argued that the relationship was consensual in the beginning and the charges came following its breakdown. Reliance was placed on WhatsApp messages and photographs, which were said to demonstrate voluntary involvement and intimacy, including exchanges immediately surrounding the first alleged incident.

title: Gold price prediction today: Will gold and silver rates continue to go down?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may trade with a bearish bias, and the silver market is very tight, according to Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan:

title: Amazon wants 80% of its developers to use AI for coding, but on one condition
content: Amazon is mandating its developers use its in-house AI coding tool, Kiro, aiming for 80% weekly adoption. This directive faces internal resistance, with 1,500 employees advocating for rival Claude Code, citing its superior performance. Despite significant investments in AI, including Anthropic and OpenAI, Amazon's own engineers express doubts about Kiro's value, preferring external models.

title: Daily habits for gut health: What experts have to say
content: Bowel problems are common, but simple daily habits can significantly improve gut health and prevent issues like constipation, piles, and even colorectal cancer. Experts emphasize adequate fiber intake, hydration, regular exercise, and respecting the urge to pass stool. Avoiding processed foods and listening to your body's signals are crucial for long-term well-being.

title: 'Used to be at home, realised...': Woman explains why she started driving auto at 65
content: Mangala Awale, 65, drives an auto-rickshaw daily in Maharashtra. She chose independence over dependence on her children.  Her decision challenges traditional views of ageing.  She earns her own money and contributes to her son's household.  Mangala obtained her driving license legally.  Her story shows that age is not a barrier to purpose and self-reliance.

title: 'To people like him, woman nothing more than body': Congress MP flays BJP leader
content: Congress MP Jothimani condemned alleged misogynistic remarks by BJP district president V V Senthil Nathan, stating he views her as merely a "body, a sexual object." Police registered a case against Nathan for insulting womanhood during a BJP protest.

title: Resignation twist: Assam neta ‘quits’; Rahul and Himanta woo him — row explained
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma invited former Congress chief Bhupen Borah to join BJP after his resignation. Sarma lauded Borah as a "last Hindu leader" in Congress, highlighting internal party issues. While Congress leaders claim Borah reconsidered, he seeks time to decide. Opposition leaders vowed to prevent him from joining BJP.

title: Indian man accused of sexually assaulting minor held in New Jersey; ICE takes custody
content: An Indian national, Vodela Yashaswi Kottapalli, has been detained by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) on charges including the sexual assault of a minor in New Jersey. ICE stated he is being held pending removal proceedings, highlighting intensified actions against undocumented migrants accused of crimes.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: Hydration myths exposed: The hidden dangers to your kidneys
content: Kidneys require consistent, moderate hydration, not just when thirsty.  Sipping sugary or caffeinated drinks doesn't suffice, and overhydration can be harmful.  Dr. Ajay Aggarwal highlights that both too little and too much fluid can damage these vital organs.  Monitoring urine color is key to finding the right balance for optimal kidney health.

title: Saudi Arabia’s 'work interruption' explained: What happens when domestic workers stop showing up
content: Saudi Arabia introduces a new digital service on Musaned for handling domestic worker contract terminations. This service allows employers to legally end contracts when workers stop showing up. It provides a structured process with defined timelines for both employers and workers. This reform aims to increase transparency and efficiency in the Kingdom's labor market.

title: Safety-first approach, brittle batting: Why Pakistan froze before India’s ingenuity
content: Pakistan's meek surrender against India in the World Cup left fans bewildered. Despite possessing spinners suited for the slow Colombo pitch, Pakistan's decision to field first and their batting approach proved costly. Poor form from Shaheen Afridi further hampered their efforts, leading to a defeat that highlighted their inability to learn from past mistakes.

title: What happened between Stable Ronaldo and Ed Craven? Kick controversy explained
content: Stable Ronaldo criticized Twitch’s new Plus Program revenue split in February 2026. Kick CEO Ed Craven then accused him of using fake viewers. Ronaldo responded by showing Twitch analytics, revealing over $265,000 earned in January 2026. He denied the claims and questioned Craven’s leadership, while also alleging Kick once offered him millions to switch platforms.

title: ‘You don’t deserve that chair’: Navjot Kaur Sidhu slams Rahul Gandhi
content: Former Congress leader Navjot Kaur Sidhu has sharply criticized Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of being out of touch with ground realities and ignoring corruption within the Punjab Congress. She alleged that election tickets are being sold while Gandhi remains unaware, stating his inaction is destroying the party in Punjab and questioning his leadership.

title: ‘In the lap of the gods’: How Australia can still reach Super 8s in the T20 World Cup
content: Australia face an early T20 World Cup exit after a crushing eight-wicket defeat to Sri Lanka. Captain Mitchell Marsh admitted the team's fate is now out of their hands, relying on other results to qualify for the Super 8s. A strong start faltered, leading to a collapse and a chase dominated by Pathum Nissanka's century.

title: ‘Nothing to hide’: Trump responds to Epstein link claims; takes dig at Hillary Clinton
content: President Trump reiterated his denial of any involvement with Jeffrey Epstein, stating he has been "totally exonerated" and has "nothing to hide." He claimed investigations cleared him and suggested Epstein opposed his election. Released files reference past contact and Trump's comments to investigators, though officials found no credible information warranting further investigation into him.

title: Set ablaze by husband, MP woman walks 4km to police, seeks no FIR for kids' sake
content: In a harrowing tale of survival, a woman from Chhatarpur endured a brutal attack at the hands of her husband, who allegedly beat, strangled, and set her ablaze. Against all odds, she sought refuge in a haystack overnight and managed to escape. The following morning, she courageously trekked nearly 4 kilometers to the police station, ready to tell her story.

title: Internet erupts over Erika Kirk’s ‘missing’ posts amid Owens feud
content: Online speculation erupted after a viral screenshot suggested Erika Kirk deleted Facebook posts months after Charlie Kirk’s death. The image showed a page under her maiden name displaying “no posts available,” prompting debate amid her ongoing feud with Candace Owens. However, no verified reports confirm deletion, and differences in accounts, privacy settings, or inactive pages may explain the confusion.

title: Explained: Saudi Arabia's new 90-day health insurance policy for overseas Hajj, Umrah pilgrims
content: Saudi Arabia is enhancing healthcare coverage for millions of Muslim pilgrims undertaking Hajj and Umrah. The new policy offers emergency health coverage for up to 90 days, including urgent medical treatment, hospitalisation and accident injuries. This initiative aims to ensure pilgrims' safety and peace of mind during their spiritual journeys.

title: Siddaramaiah camp to take 27 MLAs abroad 'to counter DKS push for CLP meeting'
content: A foreign tour by Congress legislators aligned with CM Siddaramaiah has intensified a power struggle with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar over a rumored leadership transition.  While legislators claim the trip is routine, insiders view it as a tactic to counter Shivakumar's push for a CLP meeting to discuss a change in leadership.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,600; BSE Sensex drops over 200 points
content: Stock market today: After a strong rally yesterday, the stock market indices Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was below 25,600, BSE Sensex dropped over 200 points in opening trade.

title: Classmate 'mistreated' Indore MBA student's body after killing her, performed occult rituals
content: A 24-year-old MBA student was found murdered in her classmate's rented house in Indore. The accused, who was in a close relationship with the victim, allegedly strangled her after suspecting her of talking to other men. He later fled and was apprehended in Mumbai, where he reportedly performed occult rituals while on the run.

title: Why Zimbabwe and Ireland is a make-or-break clash in the T20 World Cup
content: Zimbabwe and Ireland's upcoming T20 World Cup match is crucial, potentially deciding Australia's fate. Sri Lanka has already qualified. Zimbabwe, with two wins, faces Ireland, who are still mathematically alive. A Zimbabwe victory sends them through and eliminates Australia. An Ireland win opens the door for Australia, but they'll need a strong performance and favorable net run rate.

title: Rafale deal, AI, trade: French President Macron set to meet PM Modi in Mumbai — what's on agenda
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and First Lady Brigitte Macron arrived in Mumbai for a three-day visit to strengthen the India-France strategic partnership. The agenda includes bilateral talks with PM Modi, focusing on defence, space, and technology, and participation in the AI Impact Summit.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: NTPC, Power Finance Corporation, and Union Bank of India are the top stock picks by Somil Mehta, Head - Alternate Research, Capital Market Strategy, Mirae Asset Sharekhan for February 17, 2026. Let’s take a look:

title: The Godfather fame actor Robert Duvall passes away at 95
content: Veteran Hollywood star Robert Duvall, known for his iconic performances in The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95. His death on Sunday was confirmed by his wife, Luciana Duvall, on Monday.

title: Addi Smith, mother Tawnia McGeehan die in suspected murder-suicide
content: Tawnia McGeehan and her daughter, Addi Smith, were found dead inside a Las Vegas hotel room after missing a cheer competition. Police believe the Utah mother shot her child before taking her own life. A note was discovered, and the investigation continues. Utah Xtreme Cheer shared an emotional tribute, calling the loss heartbreaking for the entire community.

title: 'Drop them': Shahid Afridi slams son-in-law Shaheen Shah Afridi, Babar Azam after 61-run defeat
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has called for the exclusion of senior players like Babar Azam, Shadab Khan, and Shaheen Shah Afridi following their T20 World Cup loss to India. Afridi urged the management to try fresh faces against Namibia, stating the current seniors haven't delivered consistent results despite ample opportunities.

title: Cardi B confirms breakup with Stefon Diggs while defending him on tour
content: Rapper Cardi B confirmed her breakup with NFL player Stefon Diggs during a concert. She publicly defended Diggs against rapper BIA's online remarks. This happened after Diggs's Super Bowl performance. Cardi B stated Diggs remains family despite their split. The couple had unfollowed each other on social media earlier. Speculation about cheating allegations also surfaced.

title: 📈 Men's NCAA Tournament Bubble Watch
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections .

title: The top 10 women's college basketball games left in the regular season
content: the 2025-26 women's college basketball season is now a two-week sprint to decide regular-season champions and conference tournament positioning . south Carolina has done most of its heavy lifting with a 3-0 SEC record against LSU , Texas and Vanderbilt .

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?
content: a group of fans are angry at baseball . they are inside of group chats that talk about how much money the Los Angeles Dodgers are spending . owners blame the system that governs Major League Baseball . a salary cap would juiper the game, owners say .
